description:
Sobre a vaga
A Sylvamo acredita no desenvolvimento de seus talentos! Para nós, o Recrutamento Interno é essencial para o crescimento dos nossos profissionais e do nosso negócio. Priorizamos nossos profissionais sempre que surge uma oportunidade, então, é importante estar preparado para identificá-la e avaliar se está alinhada aos seus interesses de carreira. Para isso, faça One-on- One com seu gestor e com profissionais que possam contribuir para o seu crescimento.

Nós valorizamos Infinitas Possibilidades e por isso oferecemos muitas oportunidades para você! E você pode contribuir para o nosso desenvolvimento contínuo e sucesso!

Who We Are And What You Will Do

The Entry Level Security Analyst position is part of the Global Information Security (GIS) organization within Information Technology. The position has global responsibility for developing and sustaining the secure architecture and design of Sylvamo's IT infrastructure. This position will be located in Memphis, TN, Brazil, or Poland.

The key actions, outputs, deliverables, products and Services include :

Implement enterprise-wide Cyber Security system and application solutions, with an emphasis on role-based security..
Consult on projects that need security technical expertise to maximize their success and achieve Security approval for project state changes.
Build, deploy and maintain systems and software, including networking components, identity management, security audits and vulnerability management.
Work with enterprise architects and developers to design optimal security practices when developing new system, network and application functionality.
Document existing systems architecture and technology portfolio, with a focus on the continuous improvement of Uline’s security posture.
Communicate and coordinate with other architecture groups and business units.
Assist with Azure Security (AD, Security Center, O365 security)
Assist with Network Security standards and architecture
Research and write GIS Technical Security Standards, Guidelines and review policies for all areas of Information Security.
Provide technical expertise as part of Cyber Incident Response 24/7.
The key Accountabilities (outcomes) and Actions of this position include

Learn and be able to support on all of Sylvamo’s IT tools, policies, and processes globally.
Develop security guidelines and standards for the secure enablement of IT systems and processes in accordance with security policies.
Provide support on all areas of Cyber Security strategy and security controls for applications and project as well as Cloud Security
Develop and build relationship with all Cyber security towers to be able to provide backup support when needed.
Major/Primary Activities: Service Delivery; Support (RFS); Provisioning; Reporting; Monitoring; Metrics; Maintenance; Acquisitions & Divestitures; RFPs; Disaster Recovery; Consultation.

Who You Are And What You Will Need

Associates Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline or equivalent work experience
1+ years of IT work experience
1+ years of Information Security experience
1+ years IT business analysis and design experience with exposure to customers.
1+ years of Cloud Security experience (Azure and/or AWS and/or Google Cloud)
Ability to analyze new IT solutions, identify potential security concerns, develop approaches that can be used to mitigate identified risks, and work with team members to implement recommendations.
Experience conducting vulnerability and penetration scans
An advanced understanding and practical application experience of IS and security related technologies and services across multiple security domains.
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to write clear, concise business communication for multiple levels (management, technical, and user).
Knowledge and understanding of Operational Technology and SCADA network and design principles.
Minimal Travel (<10%); Minimal lifting / physical requirements
O grupo Sylvamo respeita a diversidade e oferece oportunidades para candidatos qualificados independente de suas características.
Para a Sylvamo, diversidade é incentivar o respeito e a interação criativa de diferentes culturas, gerações, gêneros, raças, formações e outras características.
Candidatar-se agora

required_skills: ['Análise de dados', 'Banco de dados', 'Analítica de dados', 'Azure Data Factory', 'DAX (Expressões de análise de dados)', 'Dashboards', 'Data warehouse', 'Dicionários', 'Inteligência de negócios (BI)', 'Microsoft Power BI']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

Power BI Developer will help transforming raw data to valuable and meaningful insights in the form of appealing dashboards and reports. Power BI Developer should understand the Power BI platform and its tools very well. A Power BI Developer takes complete responsibility of the development.

What You Will Do:
Create, maintain, and enhance enterprise and application-level reports using Microsoft Power BI platform.
Provides design consulting in the areas of Analytics, Data Warehousing, Scorecards, Dashboards, Business Performance Monitoring and Data Mining.
Provide functional and technical subject matter expertise in various data management, warehousing, business intelligence and Big Data solutions.
Standardize cross-departmental data definitions, KPIs, and calculations.
Provide status reports to senior management; and create data visualizations that leverage all features of Power BI (Parameters, Filters, Advanced Charts, Data Connections, Actions, Dashboards, etc.) with these visualizations presenting data to distinguish patterns and recognize trends, by presenting complex patterns in the form of easily deciphered charts and graphs.
Identify and participate in process improvement initiatives that improve the internal customer experience.
Create custom SQL to query complex data models in the most effective way for the database and the application servers.
Act as the liaison between business stakeholders, developers, infrastructure teams and project management groups
Analyze data requirements, application and processing architectures, data dictionaries and database schemas while designing, developing, amending, optimizing, and certifying database designs to satisfy reporting needs.
Assist in monitoring system performance, reliability, availability, and recoverability of the DW environment.

What You Will Need:

Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in business or a STEM field is preferred.
Typically, 5 or more years of experience in BI Development.
Must have Power BI Development experience.
Nice to have Azure Data Fundamentals
Nice to have Azure Enterprise Data Analyst Associate
Nice to have Power BI Analyst Associate and/or Certified Business Intelligence Professional
Nice to have Agile/Scrum Certifications

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities
Highly proficient in Microsoft Power BI development
Highly proficient in SQL
High proficient in developing solutions using Power Platform.
Experience in the Azure suite such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, and Azure Synapse is nice to have,
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills consistent with a client group, including senior managers & executives.
Attentive to details
Highly proficient in translating complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Work with data warehouse team to identify data dependencies and data requirements.
Experience in writing DAX queries and functions.
Ability to manage highly confidential material.
Working knowledge of the ABS Health, Safety, Quality and Environmental Management System.
Advanced English

Reporting Relationships:

Reports to the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence

Working Conditions:

Work will normally be performed in an air-conditioned office environment and will generally be non-manual in nature. Occasional travel will be required to perform Principal Duties and Responsibilities.

About Us

We set out more than 160 years ago to promote the security of life and property at sea and preserve the natural environment. Today, we remain true to our mission and continue to support organizations facing a rapidly evolving seascape of challenging regulations and new technologies. Through it all, we are anchored by a vision and mission that help our clients find clarity in uncertain times.

ABS is a global leader in marine and offshore classification and other innovative safety, quality, and environmental services. We’re at the forefront of supporting the global energy transition at sea, the application of remote and autonomous marine systems, cutting-edge technical solutions, and many more exciting advancements. Our commitment to safety, reliability, and efficiency is ever-present, guiding our clients to safer and more efficient operations.

Equal Opportunity

ABS Bureau is committed to the equal employment opportunity of its employees and prohibits discrimination against any employee or qualified applicant based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status, or other non-work-related characteristics that may be protected under the law of the Federal Government or specific state employment laws.

Notice

ABS and Affiliated Companies (ABS) will not pay a fee to any third-party agency without a valid ABS Master Service Agreement (MSA) authorized and signed by Human Resources. Any resume, CV, application, or other forms of candidate submission provided to any employee of ABS without a valid MSA on file will be considered property of ABS, and no fee will be paid.

Other

This job description is not intended, and should not be construed, to be an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with the job of the incumbent. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of the principal job elements essential for making a fair decision regarding the pay structure of the job. #ogjs

required_skills: ['Algoritmos', 'Desenvolvimento de software', 'Java', 'Linguagens de programação', 'Programação (computação)', 'C (linguagem de programação)', 'Ciência da computação', 'Desenvolvimento Android', 'Estrutura de produtos (BOM)', 'GBS']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Position Summary

SOBRE A SAMSUNG E O SRBR

É missão da Samsung inspirar o mundo e moldar o futuro com ideias e tecnologias transformadoras!

E você sabia que muitas dessas inovações são pensadas e desenvolvidas por talentos brasileiros e impactam a vida de milhões de pessoas pelo mundo?

Nosso Centro de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento - o SRBR - conta com duas unidades no Brasil, em Campinas/SP e em Manaus/AM, com atuação nas áreas de Inteligência Artificial, Segurança da Informação, Ciência de Dados, Desenvolvimento de Software e Automação, e é referência em tecnologias aplicadas à saúde e bem-estar.

Aqui no SRBR respiramos inovação! Trabalhar em um P&D é estar sempre à frente, olhando para o futuro. Por aqui, profissionais da tecnologia e da área da saúde trabalham, pesquisam e criam soluções juntos, com muita sinergia e colaboração, em um ecossistema disruptivo que inclui universidades, institutos de pesquisa e acadêmicos.

Nosso DNA é de pura inovação e criatividade, sem perder nossa essência de empresa sólida, consistente e em pleno crescimento.

Nosso jeito de trabalhar está em constante evolução! Acreditamos na potência do trabalho presencial para a sinergia entre as equipes e atualmente temos uma política de home office ;)

Vem transformar o mundo com a gente! Vem ser #SAMSUNGER

Role And Responsibilities

Desenvolvimento de software para smartphone, smartwatches e dispositivos IoT.

Construindo e validando a prova de conceito (POC) e o piloto para o cenário B2B.

Pesquisar, analisar e desenvolver prova de conceito (POC) para validar novas idéias ou conceito de cenário B2B.

Colaborar com a implantação e automação de testes de pesquisa de pesquisa.

Requisitos

Programa de graduação em engenharia de computadores, ciência da computação, matemática computacional, engenharia elétrica ou área relacionada, desde que possuía uma forte experiência em computação.
Forte base na programação, algoritmos e computação em geral.
Bom conhecimento em Java e C/C ++.
Conhecimento no desenvolvimento do Android.
Conhecimento em fundamentos do banco de dados.
Conhecimento em Fundamentos de Redes.
Inglês avançado

Requisitos Opcionais

Boas habilidades de programação.
Bom conhecimento da API da estrutura do Android.
Conhecimento adicional de sistemas operacionais Linux, plataforma de servidor em nuvem etc.
Conhecimento do sistema de construção Git (GBS).
Experiência em desenvolvimento de aplicativos no Android Studio.
Experiência prática com ferramentas de versão do código -fonte (Ex: Git, Github, Bitbucket).

Local: Campinas

Skills And Qualifications

NOSSOS BENEFÍCIOS:

O bem-estar das pessoas é prioridade por aqui, por isso oferecemos o SRBR Health, um programa com várias ações focadas na saúde física e mental dos colaboradores. Temos sessões de massagem, relaxamento e alongamento e oferecemos acesso à plataforma Zenklub, serviço de atendimento online com terapeuta, psicólogo, psicanalista ou coach.
Nossas mesas de pingue-pongue fazem muito sucesso, e para descobrir os novos talentos esportivos, promovemos um torneio anual que é bem disputado.
Horário flexível.
Vale refeição.
Pano de saúde (extensível aos dependentes legais).
Plano odontológico.
Seguro de vida.
Vale transporte ou fretado.
Portal com descontos exclusivos em produtos Samsung.
Temos uma plataforma de desenvolvimento e aprendizagem, o Samsung U, com acesso a milhares de cursos online.
E um ambiente de trabalho que estimula a criatividade, o trabalho colaborativo e a conexão entre os times.

Diversidade, Equidade e Inclusão

Acreditamos no poder das diferenças para criar inovações que atendam e representem todas as pessoas! Estamos em um amplo processo de evolução de um local de trabalho com mais diversidade, equidade e inclusão, por isso valorizamos as candidaturas de todas as pessoas e suas identidades de gênero, etnia, raça, religião, orientação sexual, idade ou deficiência.

As informações confidenciais e proprietárias obtidas por você durante seu histórico de emprego em outras empresas devem ser mantidas como tal (Confidencial & Proprietária) durante todo o processo de seleção, não devendo, em nenhuma hipótese, ser abertas ou compartilhadas com os entrevistadores.

Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here.

required_skills: ['Banco de dados', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Abordagem lógica', 'Atendimento ao cliente', 'Competências interpessoais', 'Comunicação interpessoal', 'Conformidade regulatória', 'Resolução de problemas', 'Treinamento', 'Vendas']
description:
Sobre a vaga
NSF International is a growing global public health and safety organization. Our mission is to protect and improve human and planet health by enabling safe food, clean water and life-enhancing health technologies and products for millions of people around the world. We do so by developing standards, testing, auditing, certifying, and providing advisory services to clients in the food, water, health sciences and consumer industries.
Our nearly 3,000 employees provide services in over 180 countries through many of our global offices, at our 35,000 client sites, from home offices and in state-of-the-art laboratories. We’re growing fast and expanding into new areas such as sustainability and digital. And that’s where you come in. Come join a team that makes a difference in the world.
More information about NSF International can be found at nsf.org.
DESCRIPTION:
As a Operations Analyst - Training you will be responsible for schedule, coordinate and provide materials for a variety of NSF’s training courses, liaising with our trainers and learners on a regular basis.

Principal Accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
Prepare, facilitate, monitor, evaluate and document revenue-generating training activities.
Coordinate and plan the resources necessary for successful delivery of training courses.
Maintain documentation and recordkeeping in compliance with corporate, accreditation and client requirements)
Identify areas of process improvement and recommend solutions to management.
Lead implementation efforts as directed.
Respond to customer service enquiries regarding course offerings.
Responsible for creating and sending internal campaigns for open and in-company training;
Support to the sales team regarding training materials;
QUALIFICATIONS:
Previous experience in a customer service/administrator role
A methodical and logical approach with good problem-solving skills
Ability to plan, organize, and multi-task
Detail-orientated
Good interpersonal skills with an ability to work on own initiative
The ability to play work and meet deadlines
Experience with databases, and advanced excel skills
Intermediate Spanish

description:
Sobre a vaga
Responsible for the analysis and monthly closing of the average cost of the Company's inventories, analysis and preparation of inventory adjustments in the cost and accounting module, ensure the accuracy of inventory valuation, review of imports and intercompany entries, prepare of internal controls regarding inventories to be reported to Headquarters in Copenhagen. Interaction with finance, tax and FP&A teams. SCOGS accounting releases, active participation in monthly closings, reconciliation between accounting and cost, ensuring that processes are being followed in accordance with company procedures and policies (Compliance), focal point for internal and external audits regarding to inventory and cost.

Activities:
Analysis and closing of the average monthly cost.
Analysis and realization of inventory adjustments.
Strong performance in compliance to ensure the company's processes and policies
Bring relevant information and financial analysis reports regarding the company's inventories and losses.
Ensuring compliance with processes in accordance with company procedures and policies (Risks & Compliance).
Service to Internal and External Audits
Record of intercompany operations (inputs and outputs) in the accounting.
Registration of imports and cost allocation.
Ensuring the accuracy of the values of the import documents and their appropriate appropriations in the result.
Elaboration and explanations of the internal controls with the superior and the Internal Audit.
Appropriation of SCOGS
Improvement in import processes and cost analysis
Ensuring the accuracy of inventory valuation
Modules used: SAP (Accounting, Finished Goods Inventory), UX and SQL

Educational background: Bachelor in Accounting; Business Administration; Economics. MBA is desirable.

Qualification:

Experience Retail market.

Experience in financial department.

Computer Skills:

Knowledge of SAP (desirable but not essential)

Knowledge in SQL server

Knowledge in Power BI

Office Package - Excel – Advanced

Language Skills:

English required

Spanish (desirable)

At PANDORA we are guided by four values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and we deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

location: São José dos Campos, São Paulo, Brasil
description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

At Johnson & Johnson, the largest healthcare company in the world, we come together for one purpose: to transform the history of health in humanity.

Diversity & Inclusion are essential to continue building our history of pioneering and innovation, which has been impacting the health of more than 1 billion patients and consumers every day for more than 130 years. Regardless of your race, belief, sexual orientation, religion, or any other trait, YOU are welcome in all open positions at the largest healthcare company in the world.

When You Join Johnson & Johnson, Your Move Could Mean Our Next Breakthrough.

This is a Cross-Sector role. Learn more about our Sectors:

Medical Devices

At Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, we are using our breadth, scale, and experience to reimagine the way healthcare is delivered and to help people live longer, healthier lives.

In a radically changing environment, we are making connections across science and technology to combine our own expertise in surgery, orthopedics, and interventional solutions with the big ideas of others to design and deliver doctor and patient-centric products and solutions.

We are in this for life.

We are changing the trajectory of human health, YOU CAN TOO.

Please visit https://www.jnjmedicaldevices.com/es-419 for more information.

Pharmaceuticals

At Janssen, we’re creating a future where disease is a thing of the past. We’re the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, working tirelessly to make that future a reality for patients everywhere by fighting sickness with science, improving access with ingenuity, and healing hopelessness with heart. We focus on areas of medicine where we can make the biggest difference: Cardiovascular & Metabolism, Immunology, Infectious Diseases & Vaccines, Neuroscience, Oncology, and Pulmonary Hypertension.

We are Janssen.

Our mission drives us.

Our patients inspire us.

We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.

Please visit https://www.janssen.com/ for more information.

We are searching for the best talent for Payroll Analyst Junior Fixed term to be in São José dos Campos.

Purpose: The Global Services Finance area is looking for a Regular Payroll Analyst to be part of our Brazil Payroll operations. The successful candidate will be part of the group in charge to ensure a flawless execution & delivery excellence of the E2E Payroll process for 4.500+ employees divided into the different group of companies in Brazil.

You Will Be Responsible For

Performing interface/data validation and addressing corrective and preventive actions to ensure leveraging overall accuracy and timeliness for all the inputs addressed to the Payroll system (FPW).
Assists with the test validation of Time & Attendance and Payroll systems and clocks and being updated about T&A and Payroll legal requirements for Brazil and to do critical analysis on provider deliverables of system implementation.
To run reports to perform Time & Attendance and Payroll validation to ensure payment data is constant and accurate, guiding end users (managers and employees) on day-by-day activities or on projects implementations and organizes trainings, creates communications about payroll process, customers roles & responsibilities and Time & Attendance and Payroll system functionalities.
To assist with the testing, scripts creation, analysis of results, troubleshoot system issues (specially on Time & Attendance and Payroll systems updates) and to support the payroll production team wherever needed to ensure a clean, accurate and complete payroll processing in compliance with local legislation and J&J policies and procedures, advising the department or function on established payroll policies and guidelines stablished.
Job Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business, Accounting, or similar studies is required.
1-2 years of experience in related areas is required.
Payroll process knowledge and experience in payroll operations is required.
English (Intermediate) language skills is desirable.
Knowledge in the local legislation & ancillary obligation is desirable.

Primary Location

Latin America-Brazil-São Paulo-São José dos Campos

Organization

J&J do Brasil Indústria e Comércio de Produtos para Saúde Ltda. (7600)

Travel

No

Job Function

Payroll

description:
Sobre a vaga
A bit about Torchbox
We’re the digital marketing specialists for many of the biggest charities in the UK; we build digital products for international NGOs, governments and universities; and we created Wagtail CMS, used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands more. Our team of 120+ people is UK-focused but with a significant presence in Manila and a network of remote staff all working together to drive real change for society and the planet.

We are employee-owned, which means 100% of our business is owned by our employees (we call ourselves co-owners). We share everything from our financial performance and profit to decisions about the appropriateness of future clients. Everyone is included, everyone has a voice, and everyone belongs.

It’s an excellent time to join us!

We are looking for Python Developers to join our new and exciting Brazilian tech team!
You’ll be supporting the building of web apps for our lovely, charity and public sector clients across the globe, implementing and improving our much loved open source Content Management System - Wagtail. You’ll also be working on innovative Django applications which facilitate strategic and business critical processes for our clients.
We’re looking for someone who has demonstrable expertise in Python and Django web development. You’ll enjoy working in a multidisciplinary team environment to help solve complex problems.

Our Python Developers have the following responsibilities:
Working with designers and product managers and the technical lead to explore and solve complex problems
Working within a client’s engineering team and supporting them to get the most of out of Wagtail for their organisation
Working within teams of developers at Torchbox building Wagtail sites and enhancing Wagtail as a product
Building new Wagtail features which may be funded by our largest clients (e.g. workflow, commenting)
Providing consulting to Wagtail Support clients
Working on sprints focused on tech debt and code restructuring
Working on implementation of features on the Wagtail roadmap

The successful candidate will also have the following technical skills:
Excellent Python and Django skills
Experience with the development and maintenance of production grade Django apps is a must
Experience writing clear documentation
Experience communicating with clients and gathering requirements
Fun to work with, great teamwork and collaboration skills
Experience prioritising your own workload
Expertise in git and branch management
Ability to quickly understand existing codebases
Experience developing with React
Previous contributions to open source projects
Knowledge of GDPR/LGPD is desirable
Knowledge of Wagtail is desirable

As we are a UK based company, this role will require you to have a good level of written and spoken English, as you will be working with UK project teams and clients.

What we offer.
The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place.
Competitive remuneration with annual review and quarterly profit share.
Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.
Flexible working hours and fully remote.
Regular virtual events

Everyone is welcome
We’re committed to being an inclusive employer, from recruitment through to everyday life. If you need help or have questions - give us a shout - recruitment@torchbox.com +44 (0) 1608 811 870
But, no agencies, please.

Analista Técnico de Pós-venda PL

A MSXI está em busca de profissionais formados em Engenharia, Administração ou áreas afins. Aqui você será responsável por diagnosticar, orientar e acompanhar a utilização das ferramentas que cercam o departamento de pós-venda, sendo ponto de apoio para a rede de concessionárias.

Experiencia em ferramentas de garantia, diagnóstico e peças – desejável;

O que podemos lhe oferecer?

Sobre a MSXI

Com aproximadamente 4.000 colaboradores presentes em mais de 80 países em todo o mundo, nossos times proporcionam liderança e expertise na indústria automotiva e suas redes de concessionários nos seguintes produtos:

Warranty & Technical

Construindo confiança desde 1931, nossa reputação comprova que somos o parceiro de aproximadamente todas as marcas de veículos do mercado. Como se aplicar?

A MSXI é uma empresa de igualdade de oportunidades e incentiva a candidatura de pessoas qualificados, independentemente de sexo, raça, deficiência, idade, orientação sexual, gênero, religião ou crença, estado civil ou maternidade.

required_skills: ['Análise de negócios de TI', 'Design de interface do usuário', 'Execução de testes', 'Requisitos de negócio', 'Sales Cloud da Salesforce', 'Scripts de testes', 'Technical Specs', 'Teste de aceitação', 'Teste de aceitação de usuários', 'Usabilidade']
description:
Sobre a vaga
This is Us

Videojet Technologies, Inc. is the global leader in the manufacturing of coding, printing, and marking products. This high technology product prints variable information, such as expiration dates on grocery products, packaged goods, pharmaceuticals, or catalogues. Our industry is pivotal in ensuring end users consume their food, beverage, and pharmaceutical products safely. As the market share leader, we have operations in over 30 countries with 4,000 employees worldwide. A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (www.danaher.com), Videojet is the core of the $1 billion Product Identification Platform. We offer a results-oriented environment that is multicultural organization that promotes both diversity and inclusion through the full organization, team-centered, customer focused and quality-focused, guided by the successful Danaher Business System. Working at Videojet, gives you access to a robust career development process and exciting opportunities.

Our Core Values

We empower creativity and ground-breaking thinking to help us uncover breakthrough solutions and accelerate the pace of innovation. To ensure we set our new associates up for success when they start, we have developed a robust onboarding plan to help you ramp up successfully. We believe with conviction that diversity helps us uncover more powerful customer insights and ultimately creates an advantage in the markets we serve. And we would love to have you join us!

Your Challenge

After training and a tailored learning program when you join, the Salesforce IT Business Analyst would initially be responsible to launch Salesforce Field Service (SFS) in the LATAM region. After SFS implementation is complete in LATAM region, you will continue to champion Salesforce projects for the LATAM region. You will be responsible for proactively identifying areas for improvements and introducing innovations, factoring in customer needs, external approaches, and industry best practices. Establishing a requirements strategy for projects, managing projects, deliverables, supporting production issues and actively managing delivery based on user priorities are also critical. If you seek a continuous improvement environment and want to work to build a world-class IT organization, this role will be ideal for you.

This position is part of the Information Technology – Salesforce Applications team, that is responsible for Global Commercial and Field Service applications within Salesforce, that includes, but not limited to SFDC Sales Cloud, SFDC CPQ, Marketo & Salesforce Field Service.

This role will be based out of Sao Paulo, Brazil, where Videojet Brazil Technologies Ltda. is headquartered and offers work from home flexibility.

Your responsibilities as Salesforce IT Business Analyst at Videojet, include:

Using established global service processes, implement Salesforce Field Service in LATAM region.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications, developing new features, and improving the existing ones to increase the functionality of Salesforce and its applications.
Collaborate with product owners and business analysts to transform evolving requirements into working applications that meet the business and usability needs.
Work in partnership with business stakeholders to understand and document their business processes, issues, challenges, and opportunities.
Ownership of small to large sized projects, driving the projects to completion while ensuring process adherence and business success.
Provide critical support to end users including managing issue resolution and performing root cause analysis.
Leads user acceptance testing, identify testers, develop test scripts, and conduct test execution.
Understand integration points with other systems that interface with Salesforce, and minimize ripple effects during development.
Support Field Service projects and initiatives.
Comfortable with flexible and global work hours: this is a global team with business and team members on every major continent. There may be meetings with the team and business that may be earlier in the morning or later in the evening on a regular basis. You have the flexibility to adjust your work hours so long as job responsibilities are met.

Your experience/skills will include:

Strong analytical and data-driven approach to provide solutions, hands on troubleshooting, and issue resolution.
Strong capability to deliver results while quickly adapting to changing priorities and unforeseen challenges.
High productivity, strong work ethics, commitment to meeting deadlines and to make steady progress on long-term projects without the need for “fire drills” or last-minute panic.
Highly self-motivating and able to work without supervision since this is a flexible work-from-home position on a global team with global management.
Ability and skills to work asynchronously, using online collaboration and work management tools to maximize productivity and value-add to the business while minimizing interruptions to work.
Ability to drive towards a solution even when there is some business ambiguity.
3 years of experience in Salesforce, or other CRM system. Experience in specific Salesforce applications (CPQ, Sales Cloud, Field Service, etc.) a plus.
Salesforce knowledge: Administration, data model, sharing and security architecture, standard Salesforce capabilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in a global environment (in English), with both technical and non-technical team members and business users around the world.
Outstanding understanding of new and existing technological capabilities in Salesforce and other IT solutions and ability to apply solutions within Videojet.
Programming and/or SQL-related coding experience, and other CRM or ERP experience would be advantageous.
Good command of English language, with ability to work with the business in both Spanish and Portuguese.

Our offer

Be part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, and also where having fun and teamwork is very important. It's a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals. You will work in a leading global company, with a manager who cares about you, your strengths, and will help you to develop the best version of yourself.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

Sobre a vaga
A U.S.-based organization that is committed to offering excellent healthcare, research, and medical education services, is looking for a Clinical Data Programmer. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating policies and ideal practices for putting data standards into effect. The non-profit organization is fostering ground-breaking discoveries that will contribute to enhancing human health on a global scale. This position requires at least 4 hours of overlap with the EST time zone. The company has managed to securely raise more than $7.6mn in funding so far.

Job Responsibilities:

Assist in the creation of strategic plans for upcoming initiatives and facilities, and provide advice on best practices for database management
Develop the report specifications in collaboration with the research study team
Create, program, and evaluate clinical data reports for assigned trials and projects, including listings, summary tables, and graphics
Create data extraction software or procedures for transferring data to authorized organizations or people
Assemble several data sources into one database or dataset
Enforce adherence to the rules and guidelines for data management and data systems that apply both internally and externally, such as good clinical practice (GCP), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and organizational standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Construct standard and ad hoc query reports for project management and data integrity monitoring

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data programmer
Demonstrable experience working with Data Extraction and Reporting Services
Prior experience in the pharmaceutical and biotech industry is desirable
Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written

description:
Sobre a vaga
hEDGEpoint is present on all five continents, making information easily accessible while connecting local and global markets. We offer both vanilla and innovative hedging products, using technology to facilitate seamless transactions. Our mission is to keep clients as the focal point of all our efforts and processes, contributing to their success. Our platform offers more than 50 different commodities, currencies (FX), and more than 400 hedging products globally. We use market intelligence, technology, and transparency to deliver the best experience throughout your interaction with us.


We are a risk management solutions provider, specializing in research and hedging solutions for the agricultural and energy value chains. We are a global company, with deep expertise in global business. Our team has extensive knowledge of the commodity markets and is always ready to serve each agricultural and energy segment in a consultative and in-depth manner. Backed by extensive experience, broad market intelligence, and in-house analytics and support, we proactively provide solutions so our clients can make the best decisions for their core businesses and manage their risks and opportunities with clarity.


hEDGEpoint keeps a close watch on global movements in the commodities markets and offer more than “just information”. Our Market Intelligence professionals provide valuable analytics and insights to assist our clients in making the best decisions. With quantitative and qualitative analysis, we cover risk management and trends in the commodity markets, and address themes related to the macroeconomic universe, as well as development in the agricultural and energy sectors. We make our resources available to our customers so that we’re always the best choice.


We work as one team, without borders or conflict of interest, bringing real value to our clients. We focus on excellent client service, from producers to consumers and for all sectors in the commodity value chain, offering risk management solutions that promote security, growth, and longevity.


We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or in any other way.


JOB PURPOSE
The Compliance Analyst will be responsible for executing the activities mentioned below to contribute with hEDGEpoint on conducting its business in full compliance with applicable laws, regulations, ethical market standards and business practices.


KEY ACTIVITIES:
All activities shall be performed across all hEDGEpoint Group companies (Brazil, USA, Switzerland, etc.), to be validated by the Head of Compliance:
Track and analyze the laws and regulations (from Brazil, Switzerland, USA, and other countries) in details to check applicability to the business and give recommendations on their implementation. They may involve AMLFT, Sanctions, Anticorruption, Suitability, Ethics, among any others.
Create policies/procedures and controls to assure compliance with them, and also support the business in understanding them giving recommendations to be in compliance.
Perform compliance risk assessment, mapping the risks, processes and key controls, classifying the level of risk (impact and vulnerability/ likelihood), executing testes of effectiveness, checking evidence, and delivering recommendations for internal departments to comply with laws, regulations, ethical standards and internal requirements.
Prepare regulatory reports and regulatory authorities’ requests answers, collecting information/ evidence, executing interviews, follow-up and tests, especially those required by Brazilian Central Bank (BCB) and Comissão de Valores Mobiliários (CVM).
Implement external/ internal audits and regulatory supervisions requests, attending them on time, and executing follow-up of action plans with other departments, checking evidences.
Answer due diligence questionnaires and other regulatory information requests on time.
Create and review policies and procedures based on laws, regulations and other internal documents. Collect proper approvals, publish the documents on the portal, apply terms of commitment to employees, and control the whole policies & procedures process and repository/portal and sharepoint. Follow-up departments on updating them when necessary.
Develop the content of the compliance trainings, communication pieces, events in compliance with laws, regulations and internal policies, organize them (since the definition of the target public, sending invitations, preparing the tools - virtual or physical, acknowledgments, and doing proper follow-ups.) Apply the trainings. Track and update the legal and regulatory trainings and certifications requirements and write/ maintain the internal training/ certification policy/ procedure with HR according to the target public.
Develop and maintain Intranet and websites compliance content.
Prepare and apply Compliance surveys.
Assist on the implementation of compliance champions program.
Conduct conflicts of Interest campaigns and declarations analysis (ex.: gifts registration).
Conduct internal investigations.
Execute daily follow-up routines with the internal departments, to obtain the evidence and the implementation of action plans.
Execute compliance controls to keep the department up to date with its legal and regulatory obligations.
Prepare and maintain the department data bases updated and calculate the compliance KPIs.
Document working papers. Prepare written reports and presentations. Communicate with other departments de compliance findings and action plans.
Assist on the preparation of compliance committee presentations.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Experience with training & communication techniques.
Experience with laws and regulations analysis.
Knowledge of compliance pillars and regulations from Central Bank, CVM, CMN.
Experience working in Broker Dealer (DTVM / CTVM) Compliance Departments.
Experience with Non-Resident Investors.
High concentration level and very into reading
Proactive and open to learn all the time
Excellent communication (written/oral)
Interested in studying offshore regulations / markets and financial sector
Experience in financial sector is preferred.


QUALIFICATION - PROFESSIONAL, TECHNICAL AND ACADEMIC SKILLS:
Graduation in Law / Business Administration / Accounting / Economy / Engineering.
Experience in the financial services industry (Bank / DTVM / CTVM).
Desirable: CCEP-I/ CPA 20 / AMLFT certificate or other compliance certifications
Must be focused oriented, attentive to details, good reading skills, good synthesis ability, great writing skills (English and Portuguese), desire to learn, and logical thinking.
Interested in studying offshore regulations / markets.
Fluency in Portuguese and English. Spanish is a plus.


LOCATION
Campinas | Brazil | Hybrid


Disclaimer - hEDGEpoint Privacy Notice
By participating in our selection process, you confirm that you are aware of and agree with all the terms stipulated in our hEDGEpoint Privacy Notice. Click here ( https://bit.ly/3YwMoyK ) to view and print our Privacy Notice. To enable accessibility tools for this document, please use Adobe Acrobat Reader.

required_skills: ['Desenvolvimento de software', 'Programação orientada a objetos (POO)', 'Desenvolvimento de Salesforce.com', 'Design de software', 'Inglês', 'Monitoramento de projeto', 'Padrões de design']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Are you looking to take your career to the next level?
We are looking for a passionate and ambitious IT professional to join a recently formed, purposely built, innovative team – Salesforce Platform and Solutions - whereby you will grow as a Salesforce Developer.
You will be able to combine your solid understanding of the Salesforce Platform and its’ declarative capabilities, as well as strong Apex & Lightning programming skills, to take responsibility for transforming direction from an Architect or Technical Lead into solutions - this includes developing, testing, documenting, and maintaining them.
You will work with the Architects and Engineering Leads, contributing to the design & development of various internal P&G applications and global-scaled solutions, while also participating in the growth and having a real possibility to shape and grow the Development Pillar of the organization.

Responsibilities:
Writes high quality source code to program complete applications on time. Executes code builds to test and production environments
Understands requirements and how they translate in application features and designs creative prototypes according to specifications
Fixes bugs in existing code
Performs unit and integration testing before launch
Conducts functional and nonfunctional testing
Develops technical documents and handbooks to accurately represent application design and code
Maintains documentation per company standards
Evaluates existing applications to reprogram, update and add new features and resolves user-submitted problems and questions
Willingness to learn Architecture style/design for enterprise applications

Who we are:
P&G was founded over 180 years ago as a simple soap and candle company. Today, we’re the world’s largest consumer goods company and home to iconic, trusted brands that make life a little bit easier in small but meaningful ways. We’ve spanned three centuries thanks to three simple ideas: leadership, innovation and citizenship. The insight, innovation and passion of hardworking teams has helped us grow into a global company that is governed responsibly and ethically, that is open and transparent, and that supports good causes and protects the environment. This is a place where you can be proud to work and do something that matters.
We commit to provide you with equal opportunities in employment! We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

What we offer you:
Work in international team with global responsibilities
Internal coaching programs & training
Company Salesforce-specific training program (including certifications)
Long-term career with development and growth opportunities

Benefits:
Competitive salary
Meal voucher
Life insurance
Health insurance
Dental plan
P&G stock
Saving plan
Flexible work arrangements
Wellness programs (anti-stress massage, nutritionist, psychological support, etc…)
Physical activity benefit (Gympass®)
Benefit of medicines and reimbursement of vaccines
And others...

Required Qualifications:
1-3 years of experience in Software Development
Very good knowledge of the platform and its declarative capabilities as well as out-of-the-box functionalities
Practical knowledge of Salesforce metadata and source code driven development as well as the usage of the tools (code repository systems, deployment automation, project tracking)
Familiarity with design patterns, good object-oriented programming practices and Clean Code rules
Familiarity with good unit and integration testing practices
Fluent English (written and spoken)
The ability to work independently

Preferred Qualifications:
1-3 years of experience in Salesforce Development. (Lightning and Apex)
Practical knowledge of Salesforce DX and packaging
Salesforce certifications (for example: Administrator and Platform Developer I)
Experience in integrating Salesforce with other systems/platforms
Experience in requirements gathering and analysis and working with the business partners
DevOps / Agile programming attitude
Experience with Test Driven Development

description:
Sobre a vaga
Position Description

Analista de Comunicação

Buscamos uma pessoa para fortalecer e ampliar o nosso processo de comunicação interna na Volvo. Junto com um timaço de comunicação, queremos elevar o alcance das nossas ações e aumentar o engajamento da nossa Gente Volvo aqui em Curitiba. Vamos nessa?

Nessa posição, você vai:

Estar à frente do processo interno de comunicação e engajamento para os funcionários(as) das divisões de Tecnologia, Compras e Real Estate. Você irá conduzir, junto ao time de Comunicação, a estratégia e a execução do plano anual para estas três divisões.

Irá também atuar na criação e curadoria de conteúdo, gestão de canais de comunicação e fornecedores, além de eventos presenciais e digitais e atividades que contribuam para o avanço da estratégia do negócio.

Além disso, elaborar planos e ações estratégicas de comunicação para diferentes públicos internos, como lideranças e times técnicos, envolvendo a divulgação de diferentes mensagens e projetos dessas divisões. E vai representar muito bem a área de Comunicação de GTT/GTP/VGRE Curitiba em reuniões, cerimônias, viagens, encontros e ações do time global de Comunicação.

Para tudo isso, precisamos que você:

Tenha formação superior completa em Comunicação Social, Jornalismo ou Relações Públicas;
Já tenha uma vivência considerável em processos de comunicação organizacional em empresas de diferentes segmentos (não precisa ser apenas automotivas).
Goste de escrever, ouvir e estar próximo de várias pessoas e times diferentes, além de possuir uma excelente comunicação verbal e escrita.
Fale inglês fluentemente. Isso porque terá que defender ideias e ações em reuniões com os times da nossa sede na Suécia, e fazer parte de uma rede global de comunicadores;
Tenha bom conhecimento no pacote Office 365;
Se houver conhecimento e trabalhos comprovados com plataformas de criação gráfica, vídeo e design (pacote Adobe - Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign e Premiere), Canva e produção e edição de vídeos internos, será um diferencial.


Gostou da oportunidade? Então, se inscreve nessa vaga e vamos conversar!

About Us

O Grupo Volvo promove a prosperidade através de soluções de transporte, oferecendo caminhões, ônibus, equipamentos de construção, soluções de energia para aplicações marítimas e industriais, financiamento e serviços que aumentam o tempo de atividade e produtividade de nossos clientes. Fundado em 1927, o Grupo Volvo está comprometido em moldar o panorama futuro de soluções sustentáveis de transporte e infraestrutura. Inúmeras oportunidades de carreira são oferecidas entre as principais marcas e entidades do grupo que compartilham uma cultura de Confiança, Paixão, Alto Rendimento, Mudança e Sucesso do Cliente.

www.volvogroup.com/career

A divisão de Tecnologia de Caminhões do Grupo Volvo fornece às divisões de Caminhões e Área de negócios do Grupo Volvo serviços de pesquisas de alta tecnologia, de engenharia de ponta e de compra e planejamento de produtos, bem como suporte pós-venda. Com a divisão de Tecnologia de Caminhões do Grupo você fará parte de uma equipe global e diversificada de profissionais altamente qualificados que trabalham com paixão, confiam uns nos outros e são abertos a mudanças para poder permanecer na dianteira. Fazemos com que nossos clientes tenham sucesso em seus negócios.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Who Are We?

For more than 120 years, RIMOWA has dedicated itself to developing, creating, and producing industry-leading luxury luggage for a lifetime of travel. Luggage that was created with function, heritage, and longevity in mind. Since 2016, we have been a part of the great legacy of LVMH and have continued to innovate and deliver excellence. At RIMOWA, you don’t just stand out. You make a statement.

The main responsibilities for the Intern Position include:
Customer service by phone and e-mails in an organized manner with empathy, proactivity, flexibility, and ability to solve problems and work under pressure promptly addressing the collected needs ensuring a great customer experience.

• Act as a liaison between the customer and the repair center staff.
• Collect information, requests, complaints, suggestions, and/or criticisms during the interaction with the customer via telephone and e-mail.
• Address the collected needs in the internal areas.
• Contribute to the achievement of established goals.

We would like to speak with students from secretarial courses and business. (CRM)

What are you waiting for? Search for us over on Instagram and Twitter @RIMOWA, or check us out at www.rimowa.com.

Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to RIMOWA’s DNA. We know that for our business to thrive, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills, and capabilities in each country we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About us
AB InBev is the leading global brewer and one of the world’s top 5 consumer product companies. With over 500 beer brands, we’re number one or two in many of the world’s top beer markets, including North America, Latin America, Europe, Asia, and Africa.
About ABI Growth Group
ABI’s Growth Division is the center of innovation and tech development within ABI, which is driving ABI’s growth by developing innovations for the core beer business and creating new hyper-growth tech businesses.
ABI Growth includes the following business lines: BEES (our business-to-business e-commerce and SaaS business, also focused on new technologies), TaDa and Ze Delivery (our direct-to-consumer e-commerce businesses), and several other high-tech divisions, including fintech and venture capital.

Job Summary
Our People team recruit, develop, enable, engage, grow and reward our amazing people – as they're our greatest strength. As People Analytics & Insights Analyst you will support our People team, which is on a mission to work with our stakeholders to ensure we have the right talent, in the right place, at the right time by putting employees and data at its heart. You will work with executive leaders as a thought partner to synthesize insights and make data driven recommendations. We will together to bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
Your daily basis work will be to collect, compile, and analyze HR data, metrics, and statistics, and apply this data to make recommendations related to talent attraction and talent management.
Curious? Bold? Ambitious? Join Us!

What you'll do:
Be part of a cross-functional team, directly contributing to success of building an incredible People Experience
Generate insights to uncover business opportunities and present findings to key stakeholders and senior management to drive informed business decisions
Prioritize and find the most efficient path towards solving complex, ambiguous business problems with data, keeping a mindset of simplicity, robustness and speed above all
Work fluidly across ABI’s global and local teams and functions to make data-driven initiatives successful in an efficient way
What you'll need:
At least 1-3 years of experience in an analytics role.
1-3 years of relevant HR experience/HRIS system experience is a differential
BA/BS/MS in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative field preferred (advanced degrees are a plus).
Ability to synthesize data and insights to answer the ‘so what?’ that informs stakeholder strategy. Must be expert at presenting a compelling story tailored to each stakeholder.
Ability to deliver on tight timelines and move quickly while maintaining attention to detail.
Desire to continuously learn new methodologies, adapt to business needs, and to prioritize business goals.
Super communication, collaboration, and organizational skills with a general love of problem solving.
*Travel required for some months of the year
*English is mandatory

Technical Skills:
Advanced Excel
Experience with SQL to manipulate data and compile results
Experience in, or desire to learn, a scripting language for analysis (Python/SQL)
Experience with data visualization tools (PowerBI)
Solution-oriented mindset
Attention to detail and the ability to work unsupervised
What We Offer:
Performance based bonus*
Fourteen annual salaries*
Private pension plan
Meal Allowance
Casual office and dress code
Days off*
Health, dental, and life insurance
Medicines discounts
Gympass partnership
Zenklub partnership
Childcare subsidies
Discounts on Ambev products*
Newvalue partnership
Scholarship*
School materials assurance
Language and training platforms
Transport allowance
*Rules applied
Equal Opportunity & Affirmative Action:
ABI Growth Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon of race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
The following fields are optional, but anticipate the information for your registration*.
Remember: your data will never be used as elimination criteria in selection processes. With them, ABI Growth Group is able to analyze diversity and reduce biases in selection processes. We want to contribute to changing this reality by being an inclusive company.
For more information: www.bees.com and www.abinbev.com

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Purpose and Impact

O Customer Service Associate III executará uma escala limitada de atividades de atendimento ao cliente para nossa equipe de um único local. Nesta função, você fornecerá tarefas clerical ou administrativas para ajudar a otimizar o processamento de pedidos complexos dos clientes e resolver problemas de pedidos ou entregas.

Em cidades próximas Toledo, Itapira e Chapecó.

Key Accountabilities
Realizar tarefas administrativas ou clerical complexas em apoio a projetos e compromissos de melhoria que exijam uma compreensão básica das práticas e procedimentos de atendimento ao cliente.
Participe da execução de estratégias de atendimento ao cliente.
Informe os clientes sobre o status do pedido, faturas e outras informações padrão necessárias para concluir a venda.
Fornecer suporte administrativo e administrativo para manter e atualizar ferramentas ou sistemas e relacionamentos que suportem a previsão precisa da demanda do cliente, bem como outras bases de dados relacionadas a remessas e gerenciamento de estoque.
Lidar com questões complexas de suporte administrativo, administrativo, técnico ou de cliente sob supervisão mínima, ao mesmo tempo em que escala apenas as questões mais complexas para a equipe apropriada.
Outros deveres como atribuído

Qualifications

QUALIFICAÇÕES MÍNIMAS
Diploma de ensino superior o cursando carreira
Experiência atendimiento ao cliente
Conhecimento do pacote office (word, excel, power point)
Habilidades de comunicação verbal e escrita
Outras qualificações mínimas podem ser aplicadas

QUALIFICAÇÕES PREFERENCIAIS
Conhecimento avançado do SAP, Excel

Na Cargill, todas as pessoas são importantes. A Cargill está comprometida em criar e manter um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, onde todos e todas são tratados com dignidade e respeito. Alinhada com nossos Princípios e Valores, a Cargill proíbe qualquer tipo de discriminação e assédio contra qualquer pessoa ou candidato (a) no que diz respeito a: raça, etnia, cor, religião, nacionalidade, ascendência, sexo, gênero, identidade de gênero, expressão de gênero, orientação sexual, idade, deficiência, gravidez, informações genéticas, estado civil, status familiar, país de origem, afiliação a sindicato ou qualquer outro status protegido por lei. description:
Sobre a vaga
Título do cargo: Analista de Planejamento de Sistemas HVDC

Business: Power Grids - Grid Integration - HVDC

Missão do cargo

Fornecer suporte de maior complexidade e liderança em Projetos, envolvendo o processo de oferta de projetos com cronogramas macro e estimativas de duração e fornecimentos, bem como no cronograma detalhado dos projetos e seu acompanhamento de realização após aceitação e implementação, incluindo elaboração e acompanhamento dos documentos de planejamento, programação e de controle de prazos e durações do projeto, controle dos recursos necessários e utilizados para todas as etapas do Projeto, Engenharias, Suprimentos e Serviços de Campo. Irá trabalhar em projeto estratégico para a empresa e de grande complexidade.

Responsabilidades Principais

Liderar, acompanhar e fornecer suporte de maior complexidade para a equipe de “bidding” durante o processo de oferta na elaboração de um Cronograma Macro de Proposta, com as estimativas de duração dos processos e fornecimentos.
Liderar e/ou elaborar EAP (Estrutura Analítica do Projeto / Work Breakdown Structure) após aceitação, detalhando todo o fornecimento que faz parte do contrato.
Liderar e/ou elaborar Cronograma Detalhado do Projeto na inicialização do Projeto, expandindo todas as tarefas das Engenharias, de Suprimentos e posteriormente de Serviços de Campo.
Acompanhar o avanço de todas as tarefas e acompanhar a evolução e andamento do projeto, através da Lista de Documentos de Engenharia, dos Planos de Suprimentos e dos Relatórios de Avanço de Obra.
Validar material desenvolvido pelos demais membros da equipe e/ou elaborar o relatório gerencial durante a execução do Projeto, onde serão reportadas as curvas S das disciplinas de Engenharia, de Suprimentos e dos Serviços de Campo, indicando os desvios acumulados em cada processo.
Validar material desenvolvido pelos demais membros da equipe e/ou elaborar relatório de Medição de On Time Delivery das tarefas determinadas do Projeto, classificadas por processo, bem como de medição de Aderência ao Planejado de todas as tarefas em execução, também classificadas por Processo.
Validar material desenvolvido pelos demais membros da equipe e/ou elaborar relatório identificando os pontos críticos do Projeto, como atrasos, má qualidade, falta de avanço, problemas de fornecimento, etc., além do caminho crítico do Projeto e uma análise de riscos e oportunidades.
Liderar o suporte para a equipe do Projeto na elaboração dos boletins de medição, dos relatórios de receita, das previsões de Cash In e de Cash Out.

Formação

Seu Background:

Superior Completo em Administração de Empresas ou áreas correlatas

Conhecimentos Desejáveis

Dominar processos e métodos de planejamento de projetos, materiais e produção.
Domínio do sistema de gestão SAP (módulo MM e PS).
Conhecimento avançado em MS Project, Primavera P6, Excel e Desenhos Técnicos.
Conhecimento em Projetos EPC, Obra Civil e em Montagem Eletromecânica.
Conhecimento em Gestão de Projeto e de Construção de Subestações.

Habilidades linguísticas

Inglês Avançado

description:
Sobre a vaga
It is an exciting time at IFF as we continue to grow our Digital Operations team!

Create a change that everyone wants a taste of. Make a difference at IFF. If you haven’t heard of IFF before (treasures are truly hard to find), it’s time to get excited. Welcome to the world’s best-kept secret and scent. At IFF, we apply science and creativity for a better world, push past traditional boundaries and towards a more sustainable future. We are on a mission to co-create sensorial experiences that delight and go beyond the expectations of consumers everywhere.

While have grown over the years, we remain agile in our approach and put our custom
ers’ needs at the forefront of our thinking. We are an international collective of thinkers represented at over 110 manufacturing sites and 100 R&D centers globally. Now is your chance to join us and help us to find digital solutions to make our work even better, more influential, and more sustainable.

To achieve this ambitious goal, we need you. How You’ll Leave Your Mark as a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams.
You will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.

You will…

Identify data solutions that have business applications and translate them into design specifications and code
Write ETL processes, design database systems, and develop tools for real-time and offline analytic processing
Troubleshoot software and processes for data consistency and integrity. Integrate large scale data from a variety of sources for business partners to generate insight and make decisions
Design and conduct training sessions on tools, data sources, and architecture. Provide job aids and mentoring to team members and business users
Keep up to speed with the latest industry and technology developments, and apply them to solve analytics challenges focused on business performance
You have…
A degree in Computer Science or related
At least 5 years of software development or data engineering experience
Proficiency with languages/tools Python, SQL, Git
Experience with On Premise and Cloud based infrastructures
Strongly preferred:
DevOps or MLOps experience
Docker, Kubernetes
Experience deploying ML and non-ML data products with AWS
SAP Knowledge



Why working at IFF will be the cherry on the cake of your career. We cherish your individuality. Our diversity, equity, and inclusion programs prove that different backgrounds and attitudes are key factors to our success. We know your worth. We guarantee an attractive and competitive salary as a means of showing you our appreciation. We value your personal work style. We trust you. Whether you work remotely or on site, we want you to do what’s best for you and shape your work to fit your life. We trust your creativity. We support out-of-the-box thinking without hierarchies. In our teams, it’s the best idea that wins, not the one from the highest position. We want you to thrive. Our IFF university will meet all your personal development and growth needs because now is only the beginning. We care about you. Our health insurance and pension plans ensure that your well-being is secure – professionally and privately.

description:
Sobre a vaga
What You'll Do

This is an onsite position that will be in the office Monday – Friday from 9AM to 6PM. The BCG São Paulo IT Specialist position’s primary responsibility will be to assist the Information Technology department with all aspects of technology as it relates to Case Team Support, Office operations, and BCG IT priorities. This includes, but is not limited to, user support, computer setup, maintenance and service, telecommunications, assisting with network and infrastructure maintenance, and all other technology needs as requested.

Provide a high level of customer service while supporting case teams and office-based staff in a fast-paced environment. Support includes, but is not limited to, laptops, desktops, smartphones, and phone and voice mail systems, both in and outside the office.
Assist with the management of local technology in order to increase reliability, security, interoperability, effectiveness of customer work while reducing costs.
Understand and effectively discuss services and software provided by IT Service
Gather feedback and evaluate impact of IT Service offerings
Assist in preparing and deploying laptops for staff, including configuration and imaging of laptops
Support a variety of operating systems and applications
Assist with hardware and software asset tracking and inventory management
Coordinate the repair and maintenance of office printers and computing equipment with outside vendors
Assist with on-site technical support at special events, including, but not limited to staff meetings, customer meetings, Marketing and Recruiting events, etc.
Communicate frequently with end users as well as with local, regional, and global support teams with regard to the status of their issue
Maintain configurations of all notebook and desktop computer systems according to established BCG requirements
Assist with the documentation and updating technology related instructions/procedures/knowledge articles as required
Troubleshoot video conference and telecommunications systems
Maintain problem call history by recording calls in Service Now help desk tracking database; analyze call data to proactively identify improvement opportunities
Participate in local, regional, and global projects as appropriate to evaluate existing systems and recommend technology for upgrade and replacement; evaluate new technologies for potential applicability within BCG
Achieve annual goals and objectives, developed in cooperation with IT Service organization and local management
Provide backup to IT team across the South System
Assist with general office projects as necessary

YOU'RE GOOD AT

Focuses on excellent customer service and needs of the entire BCG user community
Strong communication skills
Displays self-starting attitude, resourcefulness and professionalism
Reliable and cooperative team player; displays consideration and respect for others
Displays tact, patience, and the ability to handle stressful situations
Demonstrates competence and character that inspires trust
Communicates effectively with the management groups and technical staff
Able to work independently, exercising sound judgment and initiative
Demonstrates strong ability to identify, analyze and solve problems
Able to respect all BCG information as personal and confidential
Focuses on continuous learning to further IT knowledge and career development
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to follow established procedures/standards

You Bring (experience & Qualifications)

B.A./B.S. degree or comparable knowledge in IT related field
3-5 years’ experience in a similar role
Fluent English, oral and written
Ability to diagnose problems and provide solutions and/or escalate to the appropriate expertise area
Solid knowledge of technologies and methodologies used in IT Services and Support
Experience troubleshooting Windows 10, Macbook OS, smartphones OS, Office Suite, Internet browsers, VPN/network connectivity, among others
Conceptual knowledge and hands-on experience in the following areas: PC/laptop hardware, software, telecommunications, mobile devices, networking, and server administration

YOU'LL WORK WITH

BCG’s information technology group collaboratively delivers the latest digital technologies that enable our consultants to lead and our business to grow. For our IT jobs, we seek individuals with expertise in the areas of IT infrastructure, application development, business systems, collaborative and social technologies, information security, and project leadership.

Diversity Statement

At Hexagon, we believe that diverse and inclusive teams are critical to the success of our people and our business. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, we do not discriminate. description:
Sobre a vaga
Estamos buscando um (a) Analista de Business Intelligence para o Time Vetta!

VOCÊ JÁ CONHECE A VETTA?

Na Vetta, acreditamos que a tecnologia e a inovação são essenciais para criar um futuro mais sustentável e eficiente para todos. Como uma empresa líder em digitalização industrial, nossas soluções estão ajudando clientes em todo o mundo a reduzir o consumo de energia, a melhorar a eficiência operacional e apoiar a transição energética através da descarbonização.

Ao se juntar à nossa equipe, você terá a oportunidade de trabalhar em projetos emocionantes e desafiadores com alguns dos maiores especialistas da indústria. Além disso, você fará parte de uma equipe dedicada em gerar um impacto positivo no mundo e em ajudar nossos clientes a alcançar seus objetivos de negócios. O Time Vetta sabe a importância do trabalho em equipe e da colaboração para alcançar resultados que atingem todo o globo – ao mesmo tempo que a carreira de cada um é transformada.

Se você quer compartilhar a sua perspectiva para um mundo mais sustentável, venha ser parte do Time Vetta! 💙

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Nesse time, você terá a oportunidade de:
Atuar como Consultor BI em projetos de clientes do ramo de prestação de serviços;
Garantir a qualidade dos dados e das integrações;
Gerar relatórios consistentes e automatizar processos documentais para uso frequente;
Extrair, transformar e carregar dados.
Produzir dashboards com base no conceito de "storytelling".

Requisitos e qualificações

O que esperamos de você para essa vaga:
O profissional precisará trabalhar no escritório do cliente, localizado na zonal Sul de São Paulo.

Requisitos e Qualificações:
Conhecimento em PowerBI;
Experiência com criação e manutenção de pacotes SSIS / processos ETL;
Conhecimento em modelagem de banco de dados relacional e multidimensional;
Conhecimento em linguagens DAX e M.

Desejável:
Conhecimento em linguagens Python e R;
Noções de Machine Learning.

Informações adicionais

SOBRE NÓS:

Somos uma empresa global de digitalização industrial, com duas décadas de experiência no segmento, que contribui com a eficiência operacional e com a redução do consumo de energia e de gases através da descarbonização. Acreditamos que, com inovação e ação, podemos tornar o mundo mais sustentável e os processos industriais mais eficientes.

Atuamos em conjunto com a SMS group, líder mundial no segmento de metais, e somos responsáveis pelo desenvolvimento de soluções digitais para nossos clientes em mais de 14 países pelo mundo. As nossas soluções contam com a combinação de experiência em processos, know-how de inteligência artificial (IA) e recursos de desenvolvimento de software para resultar em tecnologias de ponta e de otimização.

Queremos trazer soluções inovadoras, buscando melhores formas de tornar a indústria e o futuro mais sustentável por meio da descarbonização. Quer fazer parte dessa história? #VemSerVetta

Todas as nossas vagas são inclusivas e abertas a todos e todas sem distinção por deficiência (PCD), raça, cor, religião, gênero, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de diversidade.

NOSSOS BENEFÍCIOS:

Sendo uma empresa voltada para pessoas, buscamos sempre valorizar a nossa equipe. Ao entrar para o Time Vetta, oferecemos:
Cartão Vale Alimentação e Refeição de R$32,00/dia, para ser utilizado em vários estabelecimentos de alimentação e de refeição de acordo com as suas necessidades.
Auxílio home office de R$100,00/mês, além de flexibilidade no horário de trabalho.
Caso trabalhe no escritório da Vetta, em Belo Horizonte, oferecemos Vale transporte.
Pensando no cuidado, oferecemos Plano de saúde e Plano odontológico, com a possibilidade de inclusão dos seus dependentes.
Total Pass e Vittude para que você possa cuidar, integralmente, da sua saúde ao praticar atividades físicas e ter contato com profissionais de diferentes áreas da saúde.
Clube de Descontos Online – New Value, com descontos em diversas redes de produtos e de serviços.
Licença maternidade e paternidade estendida, para os pais e mães viverem essa fase com tranquilidade.
PLR - conforme tabela do sindicato.

E tem mais...
Day-Off de Aniversário.
No Dress Code. Vista-se com o que te deixa confortável!
Programa de Incentivo à Formação Contínua e Capacitação, para que você possa continuar aprendendo e compartilhando experiências.
Quer indicar alguém para a Vetta? Temos Programa de Indicação de Talentos.

Todas as nossas vagas são inclusivas e abertas a todos e todas sem distinção por deficiência (PCD), raça, cor, religião, gênero, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de diversidade.

Se interessou em fazer parte do time? Cadastre-se agora! Ficaremos felizes em ter você conosco. 💙

description:
Sobre a vaga
Se Ligga no nosso Manifesto de Cultura!

Paixão pelo CLIENTE - Sem cliente, não há Ligga. Trabalhamos para que todos os clientes (internos e externos) tenham sempre uma experiência surpreendente

Obsessão pelo RESULTADO - Somos obcecados por entregas. Muitas, rápidas e ótimas. Um dia sem entregas é um dia perdido.

Crença na TRANSPARÊNCIA - Abrimos caixas, dados e ideias. Guardar informações é um erro inaceitável

Incentivamos o PROTAGONISMO - Desafios são oportunidades para quem quer brilhar. Se há um problema , pegue pra você e resolva.

Criamos CONEXÃO - Não existe um indivíduo sem um todo. Não existe uma área sem uma empresa. Levantamos e criamos contato próximo e autêntico com nossos colegas

Buscamos uma TRANSFORMAÇÃO - Muito mais que inovar, queremos ser um marco na vida dos nossos clientes, fornecedores e funcionários. Entendemos que repetir as mesmas fórmulas não irá iniciar a transformação.

Se identificou? Venha fazer parte desse time!

Conheça mais sobre nós: https://youtu.be/ODBrON4jjb0

Responsabilidades e atribuições
Criação de script para automação de processos de negócios.
Planejar e Implementar modelos de dados utilizando conceitos de BI (ETL, Modelagem e Visualização).
Desenvolver Dashboards, painéis e relatórios.
Elaborar apresentações.
Disponibilizar informações/tabelas/acesso ao banco para suportar as demais áreas da empresa.

Requisitos e qualificações
Conhecimento em automação de processos de negócios com RPA.
Experiência em Power BI e Pentaho.
Conhecimento em banco de dados (Mysql, MariaDB e PostgreSQL).
Conhecimento em Linguagem de back-End.
Experiência com Python (Principais bibliotecas: Pandas, Numpy, Pyautogui e Selenium).
Diferencial ter conhecimento em regras de negócios de Telecomunicações.

Informações adicionais

Aqui na LIGGA nos preocupamos com você e com seu bem-estar. Fique por dentro dos nossos benefícios:🤗👇

🎁Clube de Vantagens New Value.
📶Desconto Colaborador: 50% Off na contratação de qualquer plano de Internet.
Pensando no cuidado com sua saúde e bem-estar temos:Shiatsu e Ginástica Laboral.
